business.headline: Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

Where are Indians heading this festive season? Top destinations revealedCurious where Indians are planning to travel this festive season? From bustling international cities to iconic domestic spots, these are the destinations topping the list.

Festive gold rush: Should you buy jewellery or gold stocks this season?Indians love buying gold, especially in the festive season. However, Dalal Street has also seen an upward trend, with positive domestic developments such as GST rate cuts and income tax reforms earlier in the year.

Court questions Priya Kapur's plea to disclose Sunjay Kapur assets in sealed coverThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karisma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

entertainment.headline: Ektaa Kapoor on 30 years of content creation: It's not about success but relevance Ektaa Kapoor spoke on Day 1 of the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She shared insights on her three-decade-long journey, highlighting the importance of relevance over mere success.

Ektaa Kapoor never imagined Kathal would win best film at National Awards Producer Ektaa Kapoor shared her excitement about winning the National Award for her film 'Kathal' at the India Today Mumbai Conclave. She expressed that not in her wildest dreams did she think a dramedy would clinch the award.

We're children of cinema: Kamal Haasan to youngest National Award winner Treesha Kamal Haasan congratulated young Treesha Thosar, who became the youngest recipient to win a National Award at the age of four. The veteran actor won a National Award when he was six years old.

We are tackling various judgments women are put through: Ektaa Kapoor on Kyunki... Ektaa Kapoor spoke about her experience in the film and television industry at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She appeared at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Nagarjuna gets Delhi High Court protection from AI misuse, fake content Nagarjuna Akkineni has secured a significant victory from the Delhi High Court to protect his personality and publicity rights against unauthorised use of his name, image and voice, especially in AI-generated content. This landmark ruling highlights the growing concern over misuse of celebrity identities in India's digital age.

OTT this week: Fantastic Four, Son of Sardaar 2, Slow Horses and more to stream This week's OTT line-up offers a mix of thrillers, dramas, and superhero sagas, from Marvel's 'Fantastic Four' and 'Marvel Zombies' to the much-awaited 'Slow Horses Season 5' and 'Alice in Borderland 3'. With regional gems like 'Sundarakanda' and gritty dramas like 'Janaawar', there's something for every kind of viewer.

What is the scene in The Ba***ds of Bollywood that offended Sameer Wankhede? Former Narcotics Control Bureau official Sameer Wankhede has filed Rs 2 crore defamation suit against the producers of Aryan Khan's Netflix series The B***ds of Bollywood. He has alleged that a character on the show is a parody of him.

Emma Watson says Hollywood broke her, explains break from acting Hollywood actor Emma Watson shared her reasons for taking a step back from acting in a recent podcast. She opened up about the lack of connection after 'Harry Potter' and how competition, envy and hierarchy affected her experiences on set.

Fans slash screen at Pawan Kalyan's OG screening in Bengaluru, premiere halts 'They Call Him OG' drew massive fan excitement after its release on September 25. However, the celebrations turned chaotic in Bengaluru when some fans vandalised the cinema screen, causing a temporary halt to the screening.

Naseeruddin Shah, Jim Sarbh bring Titan's story to OTT with Made in India Actors Naseeruddin Shah and Jim Sarbh are set to star in a series on how the brand Titan came about and the men who played a key role in building it. Here's when you will be able to watch 'Made In India-A Titan Story' on OTT.

Meet Treesha Thosar, 4-year-old youngest National Award winner for Naal 2 At just four, Treesha Vivek Thosar made history at the 71st National Awards, becoming the youngest ever to win Best Child Artist for 'Naal 2'.

Search trailer: Konkona Sensharma hunts for truth in Rohan Sippy's crime thriller The trailer of 'Search: The Naina Murder Case' promises a gripping crime thriller where every suspect hides secrets and social media plays a crucial role in uncovering the truth. Konkona Sensharma leads as ACP Sanyukta Das in this multilayered investigation premiering on JioHotstar.

Salman and Aamir on why older men romance younger women but not vice versa Salman Khan and Aamir Khan were questioned by Kajol and Twinkle Khanna about frequently romancing younger heroines in films. The conversation highlighted gender norms and ageism in Bollywood, sparking debate on industry practices.

Who is Bhanu Khan? Original Duniya Haseeno Ka star replaced by Mona Singh in B***ds Aryan Khan's The 'Ba**ds of Bollywood' recreates the iconic 1997 song 'Duniya Haseeno Ka Mela', bringing back Bhanu Khan's memorable dance performance through clever VFX.

Big B almost named Inquilab, Ajitabh shares the reason behind surname Bachchan Ajitabh Bachchan shared that their father, poet Harivansh Rai Bachchan, chose "Bachchan" as the family surname to reject caste identity. He also shared that Amitabh was nearly named Inquilab, while his own name was meant to be Azad.

Kareena Kapoor starts filming Meghna Gulzar's Daayra with Prithviraj Sukumaran Kareena Kapoor Khan has officially begun shooting for her 68th film 'Daayra', co-starring Prithviraj Sukumaran and directed by Meghna Gulzar. The crime thriller promises a powerful exploration of justice and societal realities.
Blockbuster: Chiranjeevi, Ram Charan, Nani on Pawan Kalyan's They Call Him OG Telugu actors including Chiranjeevi, Ram Charan and others showered praise on the film.

Star Trek actor William Shatner's agency denies hospitalisation claims Actor William Shatner's agency has denied reports of his hospitalisation following a medical emergency at his home. The actor is reportedly stable, dispelling circulating rumours about his health.

Does Rajat Bedi's Jaraj Saxena in The Ba***ds of Bollywood reflect his backstory? Actor Rajat Bedi gets to play his backstory on-screen in his comeback with Aryan Khan's directorial debut 'The B***ds of Bollywood'. IndiaToday.in shares insights on how the satirical series redeems Rajat's on-screen archetype through nostalgia and an underdog narrative.

general news.headline: Musician, present during Zubeen Garg's yacht trip, arrested by probe teamMusician Shekhar Jyoti Goswami has been taken into custody for questioning, though officials have not yet disclosed the nature of allegations against him or whether formal charges will follow.

Foreign fund licence of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO scrapped day after Ladakh violenceThe Centre has cancelled the foreign funding license licence of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO after the Leh violence, citing violations including irregular deposits, local funds in FCRA account, and foreign funding for sovereignty studies.

PAK vs BAN live score: Pakistan lose four, back to the wall in knock out matchPakistan (PAK) vs Bangladesh (BAN) live score, Asia Cup Super 4: Pakistan are in complete disarray, having lost four wickets insidethe  first nine overs. Rishad Hossain is spinning a web around Pakistan batters as he dismissed Fakhar Zaman and Hussain Talat in back-back overs.

Thin-fat Indians prove obesity isn't about size alone, says Dr Shashank JoshiDuring a session at India Today Conclave, senior endocrinologist Dr. Shashank Joshi explained that Indians usually appear slim but carry excess fat, a condition described as being "thin-fat." He said this unique body type puts Indians at higher risk of obesity-related diseases even at a normal BMI.

Foreign-backed sinister plan? Why Sonam Wangchuk is in the eye of Ladakh stormActivist Sonam Wangchuk, who was leading a hunger strike for Ladakh's statehood, now finds himself accused of sparking deadly violence in Leh. From Arab Spring references to a CBI probe on foreign funding, the celebrated innovator is now the Centre's prime target for the chaos in Leh.

Azim Premji refuses to lend Wipro road to Siddaramaiah to ease Bengaluru trafficWipro founder Azim Premji cited legal, governance, and SEZ-related constraints in refusing Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's request, but expressed willingness to collaborate on data-driven solutions to Bengaluru traffic issues.

Sameer Wankhede vs Shah Rukh, sues Ba***ds of Bollywood makers for defamationThe suit seeks relief in the form of a permanent and mandatory injunction, a declaration, and damages over what Sameer Wankhede alleges is a "false, malicious, and defamatory" portrayal in the Netflix series "Ba***ds of Bollywood.

Why Azam Khan's release from jail could mark a new churn in UP politicsThe Samajwadi Party veteran is speculated to be unhappy with chief Akhilesh Yadav and contemplating a shift to the BSP or Dalit leader Chandrashekhar Azad's party

Does age really have the final word on pregnancy?Katrina joins a growing list of Indian celebrities who are embracing motherhood later in life, challenging old timelines and societal norms. Doctors say with the right health profile, women in their 40s can and do have healthy pregnancies.

Got a couch, not chairs: Fadnavis on Eknath Shinde, Ajit Pawar ambitionsMaharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has projected confidence over his current coalition government with the Shiv Sena and the NCP even as he acknowledged the personal ambitions of respective political leaders. He emphasised that the BJP remains the central pole in the government in the state, and they don't have a "kursi" but a couch.

We are tackling various judgments women are put through: Ektaa Kapoor on Kyunki...Ektaa Kapoor spoke about her experience in the film and television industry at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She appeared at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Zubeen Garg death: SIT conducts raids, Himanta says will seek CBI probe if neededAssam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the truth behind Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore should be clear within 15 days as the SIT concludes its probe. He said a CBI investigation would be sought if the SIT probe was found unsatisfactory. The SIT raided the homes of Zubeen's manager Siddhartha Sharma and Shyamkanu Mahanta, the chief organiser of the event for which the singer travelled to Singapore.

Salman and Aamir on why older men romance younger women but not vice versaSalman Khan and Aamir Khan were questioned by Kajol and Twinkle Khanna about frequently romancing younger heroines in films. The conversation highlighted gender norms and ageism in Bollywood, sparking debate on industry practices.

Advantage NDA in Bihar, women votes may trump Muslim-Yadav factor: Top pollstersThe 243-member Bihar Legislative Assembly is slated to go to polls in late October or early November with the NDA and the Mahagathbandhan being the top contenders.

All 'no's I heard growing up shaped me: Bhumi Pednekar on challenges in cinemaActor Bhumi Pednekar spoke about bringing noticeable change and impact through her film as a part of her session titled 'Power of Presence in Changing Industry' on Day 1 of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.
I'm 32 and don't want kids, but what if I regret it at 50?IF you are a DINK couple and silently carry the weight of this question, you might want to read this.

They Call Him OG review: Pawan Kalyan lifts predictable film with unmatched auraRelease Date:Thu Sep 25, 2025They Call Him OG movie review: Director Sujeeth's 'They Call Him OG' is a fan-service to Power Star Pawan Kalyan. The gangster drama, with a Japanese connection, has redundant ideas but is lifted by rousing elevation sequences.

Grandmother, 73, deported to India after 30 years in US, didn't get to say goodbyeA 73-year-old Sikh woman who lived in the US for over 30 years was deported to India by the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Harjit Kaur, originally from Punjab, was not even allowed to say goodbye to her family before being deported to India. She was handcuffed as she was taken to the ICE centre in Los Angeles.

Nair bloc hailing Ayappa conclave, can Pinarayi give Kerala's Hindu vote a Left turnThe Opposition's apprehensions of a vote shift may not be entirely imaginary as both the Nair Service Society and an Ezhava-dominated outfit have praised the Pinarayi Vijayan government

Prasad Purohit promoted to Colonel rank weeks after acquittal in Malegaon caseLt Colonel Prasad Purohit and six others were acquitted of all charges in the Malegaon blasts case. Purohit was recently promoted to Colonel rank.

Rare alignment shows two comets racing in Earth's skiesDespite their vastly different origins and paths through space, from Earth they appeared side-by-side, creating a rare visual race across the skies.

Deva Bhau reveals how a Brahmin came to lead Maratha-dominated MaharashtraMaharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, who belongs to the Brahmin community, revealed how he overcame caste-based political hurdles to lead the Maratha-dominated state where his community makes up just 2% of the population.

Diljit Dosanjh opens up on India-Pak matches after Sardaarji 3 controversyDiljit Dosanjh addressed the controversy surrounding his film 'Sardaarji 3' and the India-Pakistan cricket matches amid national tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack.

Off the grid, on the rails: India's new nuclear deterrentIn a move that sends a powerful message to adversaries, India has publicly unveiled its new rail-based nuclear capability. It can move on tracks, hide in tunnels, and blend in with civilian traffic and adds a dynamic and elusive dimension to India's nuclear arsenal.

sports.headline: Suryakumar completes ICC hearing over Pakistan's complaint, decision on Friday The PCB lodged a complaint against Suryakumar Yadav for dedicating India's 14 September win to the Armed Forces and the victims of the Pahalgam attack. It came in response to the BCCI's complaint to the ICC over Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan's provocative gestures on 21 September.

Litton Das fails to recover for Pakistan clash, stars return for Bangladesh Asia Cup, PAK vs BAN: Bangladesh will be without skipper Litton Das due to a rib injury, with Jaker Ali continuing as stand-in, and have made three changes to their XI after losing to India.

Jasprit Bumrah avoiding death overs? Pacer rejects Mohammad Kaif's take India pacer Jasprit Bumrah called out Mohammad Kaif on X for inaccurate assessment of his fitness. Kaif had speculated that Bumrah is avoiding bowling in the death overs due to chances of injury.

IND A vs AUS A: Rahul, Sudharsan keep India in hunt for massive 412-run target KL Rahul and Sai Sudharsan have kept India A in contention of chasing a massive target against Australia A. Rahul battled fever to score a sublime 74.

India A Women stun New Zealand after Shafali Verma heroics in warmup Women's World Cup: India A Women edged out New Zealand Women in a thrilling warm-up match at Bengaluru, chasing 224 under the DLS method and winning by four wickets with three balls to spare.

Rishad Hossain is spinning a web around Pakistan batters as he dismissed Fakhar Zaman and Hussain Talat in back-back overs.

R Praggnanandhaa plays jenga at home, hilarious video goes viral India's top ranked chess player R Praggnanandhaa posted a hilarious video of him playing jenga at home. Amidst a hectic schedule, the chess star found his happy place in a friendly board game.

Arundhati Reddy suffers freak accident in injury scare for India Women's World Cup: India suffered a major injury scare as pacer Arundhati Reddy was stretchered off after a freak on-field accident during the warm-up game against England in Bengaluru.

Khalid Jamil urges AIFF-ISL clubs to solve players release issues: Need to work together Indian head coach Khalid Jamil urges the All India Football Federation and ISL clubs to address delayed player releases, which have disrupted national team preparations for crucial Asian Cup qualifiers, highlighting the ongoing club-country conflict.

Performance dictates selection: Agarkar clears air on big calls in WI series squad India chief selector Ajit Agarkar announced the Test squad for their upcoming Test series against West Indies, and fans have raised concerns over some key omissions from the side. However, Agarkar reasoned that every selection for the Indian team is strictly performance-driven.

Rishad Hossain is spinning a web around Pakistan batters as he dismissed Fakhar Zaman and Hussain Talat in back-back overs.

R Praggnanandhaa plays jenga at home, hilarious video goes viral India's top ranked chess player R Praggnanandhaa posted a hilarious video of him playing jenga at home. Amidst a hectic schedule, the chess star found his happy place in a friendly board game.

Arundhati Reddy suffers freak accident in injury scare for India Women's World Cup: India suffered a major injury scare as pacer Arundhati Reddy was stretchered off after a freak on-field accident during the warm-up game against England in Bengaluru.

Khalid Jamil urges AIFF-ISL clubs to solve players release issues: Need to work together Indian head coach Khalid Jamil urges the All India Football Federation and ISL clubs to address delayed player releases, which have disrupted national team preparations for crucial Asian Cup qualifiers, highlighting the ongoing club-country conflict.

Performance dictates selection: Agarkar clears air on big calls in WI series squad India chief selector Ajit Agarkar announced the Test squad for their upcoming Test series against West Indies, and fans have raised concerns over some key omissions from the side. However, Agarkar reasoned that every selection for the Indian team is strictly performance-driven.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
